In the sent folder I have email with .php file I attached to it and there is overlay box over the message with text from the attachment. The attached php file contains some css style definitions (although no positioning related) and I suppose this could cause this problem. I believe content of the attachement should not overlay email message body at any case. 

Reproducible: Didn't try

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create new mail
2. Add attachement with .php file with some code with prints and css
3. Send email
4. Check that email in sent folder
Actual Results:  
I see box from attachement over the message of the email.

Expected Results:  
None of the content of attahement should be visible over the body of the email.

comments.raw_text:
Confirmed in current trunk.
I'm not sure if this is security sensitive or not, but it looks to me that Javascript may be executing if you "view attachment>>inline"
If JS is executing then it is a violation of the current TB content policy.
Domi show tables and fieldset etc that I don't think could come from just CSS, hence my reference to JS execution.
